Snipsonian SCSS

Absolute

Absolutely position an element and assign its coordinates, all in one line of SCSS.
use-name: snip-absolute
type: mixin, with default-values placeholder
arguments: $coordinates
default: 0 n n 0
See information about snip-coords.

You'll save years of your life, and probably lose weight.

Example

HTML

Example

HTML

<div class="ss-absolute-container">
    <div class="ss-absolute ss-absolute-1">Top left</div>
    <div class="ss-absolute ss-absolute-2">Bottom right</div>
</div>

SCSS

.ss-absolute-container {
    position: relative;
}
.ss-absolute-1 {
    @include snip-absolute;
    // or @extend %snip-absolute;
}
.ss-absolute-2 {
    @include snip-absolute(n 0.5em 1em n);
}

Compiled CSS

.ss-absolute-container {
  position: relative;
}

.ss-absolute-1 {
  position: absolute;
  top: 0;
  left: 0;
}

.ss-absolute-2 {
  position: absolute;
  right: 0.5em;
  bottom: 1em;
}

Result

Top left
Bottom right

Coordinates

A shorthand for assigning coordinates to an element.
use-name: snip-coordinates
type: mixin only
arguments: $coordinates
default: n n n n
A list: top, right, bottom, and left coordinates. n abbreviates null. a is interchangeable with auto. See below.

You may want to use this mixin on its own — but this mixin's primary purpose is to facilitate the positioning mixins: snip-absolute, snip-relative, and snip-fixed, which pair your coordinates with a position value.

Some guidlines for this mixin and its followers:

  • n (the default value) signifies null or "nothing" or "no" — so any coordinate assigned n is simply ignored, creating no rule in your compiled CSS.
  • a can abbreviate auto (both will work).
  • All four values must be passed, so use n as needed.

Fixed

Fix an element's position and assign its coordinates, all in one line of SCSS.
use-name: snip-fixed
type: mixin, with default-values placeholder
arguments: $coordinates
default: 0 n n 0
See information about snip-coords.

Notice the example in the bottom right.

Example

HTML

Example

HTML

<div class="ss-fixed">Here's your fixed example.</div>

SCSS

.ss-fixed {
    @include snip-fixed(n 20px 10px n);
}

Compiled CSS

.ss-fixed {
  position: fixed;
  right: 20px;
  bottom: 10px;
}

Result

See the bottom right
Here's your fixed example.
